items.description: Humber estuary from Spurn Point to Winestead Outfall
items.message:
Strong winds and high tides may cause large waves and spray overtopping on the coast tomorrow morning.
Areas most at risk include The Humber estuary from Spurn Point to Winestead Outfall.
No property flooding is expected.
Flooding is possible on The Humber estuary from Spurn Point to Winestead Outfall between 05:30 AM and 08:00 AM on Sunday 21/11/2021.
After this tideâ€š the weather is more settled and no further impacts are expected.
We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.
Please be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous.
This message will be updated by 08:30 AM on 21/11/2021, or as the situation changes.

This message has been issued because some minor flooding to coastal roads and footpaths is likely  between 9:30am and 11:00am today, Sunday 21st November 2021.  We expect high tide levels at the harbourside in Southwold. The detailed forecast for those that use it is for a peak level at Lowestoft of 1.62 mAODN at 10:15am, on Sunday 21st November, which is 0.67m above tide tables, wind Force 6, Northerly. (mAODN is height above average sea level, for more info refer to local tide tables). Take care on coastal roads and footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We are monitoring the situation and are not expecting the situation to escalate.
